meanings.definition: To make something appear fuller or softer by shaking or patting it.
meanings.sent1: She was fluffing the pillows on the couch.
meanings.sent2: The stylist was fluffing the model's hair before the photoshoot.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't resist fluffing the snow before building a snowman.
meanings.sent4: The baker was fluffing the flour in the mixing bowl, creating a cloud of white.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick involved fluffing up a handkerchief to make it disappear.

meanings.definition: To make something seem less serious or important.
meanings.sent1: She was fluffing her response to downplay the situation.
meanings.sent2: The comedian was fluffing the topic to lighten the mood.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to fluff off the criticism only made matters worse.
meanings.sent4: The politician was accused of fluffing his promises to gain votes.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used humor to fluff up the lesson and engage the students.

meanings.definition: To move or handle something in a light or careless manner.
meanings.sent1: The cat was fluffing its tail playfully.
meanings.sent2: She was fluffing through the pages of the book, not really reading.
meanings.sent3: He was caught fluffing the papers on his desk instead of working.
meanings.sent4: The toddler was happily fluffing the toys around the room.
meanings.sent5: The wind was fluffing the curtains gently, creating a peaceful atmosphere.
